entity_name: Clerk of the House of Representatives, All Staff Employees
summary: The documents provided primarily focus on the payroll records of staff employed by the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). These records, including payroll authorization forms and related memoranda, detail the employment history, salary adjustments, and position changes of various HSCA staff members. The documents span from 1976 to 1979, covering the period when the HSCA was actively investigating the JFK assassination. The Clerk of the House of Representatives is implicitly involved as the administrative body responsible for managing and processing the payroll of all House employees, including those working for the HSCA. The documents highlight the administrative processes related to staffing the HSCA and managing their compensation.
significance: The Clerk of the House of Representatives, through the HSCA staff payroll records, provides insight into the administrative and financial aspects of the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination. While not directly involved in the investigative work, the payroll records offer a glimpse into the staffing and resource allocation of the committee, which indirectly supported the investigation.
